perturbation.original_text:
WHEREAS, the Fund is a closed-end management investment fund that has registered as an investment company under the Investment Company
Act of 1940, as amended (the "Investment Company Act") and that intends to operate as an interval fund pursuant to Rule 23c-3 under the
Investment Company Act;
perturbation.changed_text:
WHEREAS, the Fund is a closed-end management investment fund that has registered as an investment company under the Investment Company
Act of 1940, as amended (the "Investment Company Act") and that intends to operate without regard to the requirements of an interval fund pursuant to Rule 23c-3 under the
Investment Company Act;
perturbation.explanation: The original contract states the fund intends to operate as an interval fund pursuant to Rule 23c-3 of the Investment Company Act. The modified contract contradicts this by stating the fund intends to operate *without regard* to the requirements of Rule 23c-3. This creates a legal contradiction because interval funds are subject to specific regulations under the Investment Company Act, which this change implies the fund will disregard, leading to non-compliance.
